subject: Writing
title: Martin Luther King Jr.'s Dream
description: A quick, practical guide to Martin Luther King Jr.'s Dream.

hook.text: The most famous part of King's speech was improvised. His planned ending failed, so Mahalia Jackson shouted advice.

buildup.text: On August 28, 1963, King addressed 250,000 people at the March on Washington with a prepared text.

discovery.text: Gospel singer Mahalia Jackson called out: 'Tell them about the dream, Martin!' He put his notes aside.

twist.text: The 'I Have a Dream' section was unscripted â€” drawn from phrases King had used in earlier, smaller speeches.

climax.text: That improvised ending became the most recognizable speech in American history â€” proof that rhetoric is also instinct.

punchline.text: The greatest speech in American history was partly ad-libbed.

quiz.question: Who prompted King to speak about 'the dream'?
